job_title: Registered Nurse in Ewa Beach, HI
pros: Teaching Facility, Great Team work, milieu management, safety is priority, patient care
cons: No overtime, no consistency, and management can be more organized

review_title: Interviewed and received offer at Kahi Mahala
pros: Kind interviewers that obviously have a passion for working with this population.
cons: After getting a offer I felt disrespected by the poor pay and lack of understanding of what a occupational therapist does. I would have been expected to work weekends and holidays. Highest priority seemed to be placed on quantity of treatment not quality or outcomes. There is not consistency in what is actually offered. It was clear you will be responsible for developing this whole OT program.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Honolulu, HI
Licensed Mental Health Professional in Ewa Beach, HI
pros: Caring line staff. Beautiful setting. Good pay and benefits. Meaningful and rewarding work.
cons: One nurse in a senior financial leadership position has serious issues and casts a dark cloud over everyone. She handles minor clinical staff errors by yelling, name-calling, and being demeaning-I have seen her reduce front line staff to tears in meetings on a regular basis. Many great staff members have resigned because of her behaviors.

pros:
Good benefits
Decent pay
Incentive 
Union 
Co-workers are amazingly great
cons: Always understaffed, they give incentive for you to work 16 hour days, management doesn’t really care about their staff and are no where to be found most the time. No much area to advance,

job_title: Mental Health Specialist in Ewa Beach, HI
pros: I love the people who work on the child / acute adolescent unit.
cons: Some unit restrictions that are put on staff members interferes with unit management leading to unsafe environment for both staff and patients.

review_title: Would not recommend for long term career.
cons: Communication is poor between staff and departments

pros: The patients are amazing and it is very rewarding working with the doctors. I was able to learn a lot about medicine.
cons: No support, top heavy and clueless organization. I felt completely unsupported and alone.  The bullying culture there is accepted and encouraged. Complete hostile work environment.
